title: Jerusalem synagogue attack: protests and clashes flare after day of mourning â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: fbi launches investigation into death of us citizens .

text: a summary of today 's main developments : two men armed with knives and a gun killed four rabbis during morning prayers at a jerusalem synagogue , wounding eight others .
police killed the two palestinian assailants in a shootout at the scene , a synagogue in the ultra-orthodox har nof district .
israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu ordered the demolition of the assailants ' homes and called for the world 's uncompromising condemnation of the attacks .
netanyahu blamed palestinian leaders for wild blood libel that encouraged terrorism .
clashes between palestinians and israeli security forces broke out in the west bank , and rightwing protesters took to the streets and confronted israeli police .
netanyahu and the city 's mayor urged citizens not to take the law in your own hands .
thousands mourned the four victims , confirmed as three americans and one briton , all with dual citizenship .
the americans were named as aryeh kupinsky , kalman ze'ev levine and moshe twersky a prominent leader from an influential hasidic family .
the british victim was avraham shmuel goldberg .
the assailants were named as cousins ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal , both members of the popular front for the liberation of palestine .
the group praised the attack but stopped short of claiming responsibility .
relatives said the pair was angry about recent violence and friction around a holy site , the al-aqsa mosque , which is on a site revered by jewish people as the temple mount .
us president barack obama led the chorus of world leaders who condemned the horrific ' attack , saying there is and can be no justification for such attacks against innocent civilians .
palestinian president mahmoud abbas also denounced the attack , as did european ministers and the un secretary-general .

israeli shin bet ( internal security ) chief yoram cohen has rejected claims that palestinian president mahmoud abbas encouraged terrorism , bucking the party line established by prime minister netanyahu and other ministers .
per haaretz : no one among the palestinian leadership is calling for violence , cohen said , noting that abbas has reiterated that the path of intifada should be rejected .
abu mazen [ abbas ] is not interested in terror , and is not leading [ his people ] to terror , he told members of a knesset committee after the incident .
nor is he doing so under the table . '
at the same time , however , cohen admitted that , there are people in the palestinian community who are liable to see abu mazen 's words of criticism as legitimization for taking action .
earlier netanyahu had said incitement by hamas and the palestinian authority motivated attacks on jews .
this is a direct result of the incitement lead by hamas and abbas , incitement that the international community irresponsibly ignores , he said .
you can read the full haaretz piece here if you have a subscription .
abc 's nasser atta is watching dozens of rightwing protesters , chanting death to arabs , as they try to reach downtown jerusalem .
nasser atta ( @ nasseratta5 ) # israeli police on horses trying to stop them from reaching the center of # jerusalem
thousands mourned at the funerals of the four rabbis killed in jerusalem today , reuters reports , adding details of the men 's lives .
thousands of ultra-orthodox jews swayed in prayer at the funeral of us-israeli rabbi moshe twersky , a descendant of two rabbinical dynasties .
a man during the funeral of moshe twersky .
we are so shocked .
he was one of the world 's most amazing people , said esther greenwald , a friend of twersky 's widow , miriam , who was immersed in prayer for much of the service .
at the funeral , two of twersky 's young granddaughters wiped away tears , bowing their heads as they stood next to his widow .
twersky , 59 , had five children .
he immigrated to israel in 1990 from boston , where his late father , isadore , was a founding director of a jewish studies center at harvard university and a renowned scholar .
he was also a grandson of joseph soloveitchik , a renowned boston rabbi who died in 1993 .
meshulam twersky , the rabbi 's eldest son , hailed him as someone you could always pour your heart out to , adding that his only solace was that his father had died in prayer .
a separate service was held for the other victims : avraham goldberg , 68 , a british-israeli ; and us-born kalman levine , 55 , and aryeh kupinsky , 43 .
the israel news feed has tweeted more photos of the continuing protests around jerusalem .
israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) happening now : hundreds protesting at entrance of jerusalem following todays terror attack , 10 arrested so far .
police are in a standoff with a protest in jerusalem , and have reportedly arrested 10 people at a rightwing demonstration for disturbing the peace , according to ben hartman of the jerusalem post .
the spate of individual attacks in jerusalem like a new form of suicide attack pose a new challenge to israeli security forces , the guardian 's harriet sherwood writes .
they appear to be the work of individuals or small groups , rather than meticulously-planned operations by militant organisations .
instead of coming from relatively distant parts of the west bank or gaza , the perpetrators are mainly residents of the city israel claims as its indivisible capital .
we stopped the second intifada mainly by better intelligence and reaction on the ground , said yaakov amidror , a former national security adviser to the israeli prime minister , binyamin netanyahu .
now it 's more complicated .
instead of organisations , we see individuals .
after the suicide bombings of the second intifada , israeli forces built vast barriers , detained huge numbers of palestinians and intensified surveillance and military operations .
a response today would have to be more targeted , amidror told the guardian .
palestinian activists opening a hole in a west bank barrier earlier in november .
agency/getty images palestinian residents of jerusalem have highly-valued identity cards that allow them to travel anywhere in israel ; the cards could become political tools for security forces .
in response to the current string of attacks we have to raise the price they pay , amidror said .
if they know their families will suffer because of their actions , they may be less eager .
for themselves , they do n't care .
any further physical division of the city would be politically unacceptable , he said .
it 's almost impossible to prevent the free movement of palestinians in the city , although we may see more checkpoints here and there .
you can read the full analysis here .
everyone everywhere is in danger , a survivor of tuesday 's attack has told ap , which reports on the shaken har nof neighborhood where four were killed .
this newest assault amid a wave of other attacks engulfing jerusalem , however , has left those living in har nof , home to 20,000 people , worrying about their personal security .
most of its residents are ultra-orthodox jews , many of them immigrants from north america and western europe .
leaders of the shas party founded by religious jews with middle eastern and north african backgrounds and closely identified with a string of nationalistic israeli governments also call it home .
yitzhak heshing , who was injured in tuesday 's attack , told ap his sense of security had been shredded : not just in jerusalem but everywhere .
i think that what is happening is a very crazy situation .
everyone needs to carry a gun , heshing said .
i do n't know .
personally i think i 'll need to carry a weapon .

in the span of seven minutes , ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal used knives and a gun to hack , shoot and mutilate men at prayer , killing four and injuring eight in a horrific episode recounted by witnesses to the guardian 's peter beaumont and local news in jerusalem .
local resident sarah abrahams said : i was going for a morning walk and passing by on the road above the synagogue .

the police were already there , and when one of the terrorists emerged from the synagogue they shot him on the steps ¦ two people came out with their faces half missing , looking like they 'd been attacked with knives .
a bullet hole at the synagogue .
hollander/epa those who were inside the synagogue and survived the attack told chilling stories of horror and close escapes .
a man who identified himself only as yossi told israel 's channel 2 television : the police arrived and surrounded the entrance and then the terrorist ran out and they shot him .
there was wild gunfire .
people ran out of the synagogue .
it was hell .
i tried to escape .
the man with the knife approached me .
there was a chair and table between us ¦ my prayer shawl got caught .
i left it there and escaped .
yosef posternak , who was also praying in the synagogue at the time of the attack , told israel radio : i looked up and saw someone shooting people at point-blank range .
then someone came in with what looked like a butcher 's knife and he went wild .
you can read the full piece here .
secretary of state kerry spoke with palestinian president mahmoud abbas this morning , a us state department spokesperson says .
john kerry .

kerry earlier today denounced palestinian incitement as a cause of the attack , and said to have this kind of act , which is a pure result of incitement , of calls for days of rage ' , of just irresponsibility , is unacceptable .
abbas condemned the attack in a statement , and kerry , who tried to facilitate peace talks this summer , also called israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu after today 's attack .
my colleague paul lewis reported in depth on kerry 's remarks and calls , which you can read here .
the us considers destroying the attackers ' homes counterproductive , according to state department press office director jeff rathke .
per voice of america reporter natasha mozgovaya : natasha mozgovaya ( @ mozgovaya ) statedep : `` punitive home demolitions are counterproductive to the cause of peace . ''
# israel # palestinians rathke 's statement exposes daylight between the us position and the decision made by israeli pm binyamin netanyahu to demolish the abu jamal cousins ' homes .
some israeli officials argue the tactic deters terrorism .
us-israel relations have been unusually contentious in recent years , but even so the nations rarely stray from each other 's statements .
president obama 's expanded comments on tuesday 's attack and the israeli-palestinian conflict : we have to remind ourselves that the majority of palestinians and israelis overwhelmingly want peace
un secretary-general ban ki-moon has warned that today 's attack suggests a dangerous dimension ¦ which reverberates far beyond the region .

a spokesman for his office has issued a statement , which reads in part : beyond today 's reprehensible incident , clashes between palestinian youths and israeli security forces continue on a near daily basis in many parts of east jerusalem and the west bank .
the secretary-general condemns all acts of violence against civilians .
attacks against religious sites in jerusalem and the west bank point to an additional dangerous dimension to the conflict which reverberates far beyond the region .
the secretary-general calls for political leadership and courage on both sides to take actions to address the very tense situation in jerusalem .
all sides must avoid using provocative rhetoric which only encourages extremist elements .
in this regard , the secretary-general welcome 's president abbas ' condemnation of today 's attack .
he then reiterates a plea familiar from this summer 's 50-day war : that both israeli and palestinian leaders make the difficult decisions that promote stability and long-term security .
the white house has echoed the president 's condemnation of tuesday 's attack , saying that the senseless act is extremely disturbing .
press secretary josh earnest told reporters the us is obviously are deeply concerned specifically about this terrorist act , pointing out that three victims were dual american-israeli citizens .
netanyahu tells reporters that he does not believe that mahmoud abbas , the palestinian president , is calling for or initiating terrorism but that the palestinian authority still incites it .
the prime minister also calls for zionist opposition parties to join his coalition .
he says it 's no time for politics .
netanyahu vows retribution but urges israelis to exercise restraint .
he also demands that the world stand with israel 's uncompromising condemnation of incitement against israel .
binyamin netanyahu .
tibbon/ap i would like to see shock , i would like to see a condemnation , a real uprooting , not a compromise .
the world watches this massacre but does not demand that palestinians stop their incitement against israel , which is the root of this violence .
i expect to hear that very same uncompromising condemnation .
we will uphold law , order and security throughout the streets of jerusalem .
i have decided to dismantle the homes of the terrorists ¦ and to enforce law , to make punishments more severe , and to outlaw certain organizations .
citizens of israel i call upon you to be alert , abide by the law .
we will repay all those terrorists ¦ but nobody , nobody must take the law into their own hands , even during a storm or when the blood boils .
we need national unity at this time .

documents.title: netanyahu denounces 'incitement against israel '
text: netanyahu is speaking now , saying that the attackers were animals .
he accuses hamas , islamic jihad the palestinian authority of disseminating blood libel , and says that they lied and incited today 's attack .

we are in the middle of a wave of terror attacks ¦ those animals that committed this massacre came with great hatred ¦ against the jewish people and the state ¦ the hamas movement and the palestinian authority disseminate libels against the state of israel .
their lies have taken a price in lives .
what is most shocking is not just this massacre , but the cries of joy in gaza and bethlehem .
mourning and conflict in jerusalem and the west bank .
ultra-orthodox jews mourn over the bodies of three of the victims of today 's attack in the har nof neighborhood .

tibbon/afp/getty images a masked palestinian youth uses a slingshot to throw back a teargas canister towards israeli forces during clashes outside the israeli-run ofer military prison , near the west bank city of ramallah .
momani/afp/getty images an israeli border policeman fires a tear gas canister during clashes with palestinian protesters near ramallah .
mohammed/ap
jerusalem has been pushed a new level of tension and antagonism , my colleague harriet sherwood writes in an analysis on today 's attack .
the synagogue is the symbolic heart of any jewish community , just as the mosque is at the centre of muslim neighbourhoods .
an attack on a synagogue is an assault on jewish identity .
the recent attacks appear to be uncoordinated assaults launched by individuals or small groups rather than carefully-planned operations mounted by militant groups .

the attacks are hailed enthusiastically in the impoverished and volatile refugee camps of palestine , but so far there has been little evidence of mass support and a willingness to take to the streets among the majority of palestinians .
that could change .

netanyahu may raise the stakes with a major military operation in response to the synagogue killings , which could increase support for similar actions against israelis just as the military assault on gaza in the summer saw hamas 's popularity rise .
you can read the full piece here .
abc 's nasser atta tweets a photo of televised clashes in east jerusalem .
nasser atta ( @ nasseratta5 ) clashes now in jabel al mokhbar , home town of the two attackers of the # jerusalem synagogue
a summary of today 's main developments : two men armed with knives and a gun killed four rabbis during morning prayers at a jerusalem synagogue , wounding at least eight others .
the two palestinian assailants were killed in a shootout with police at the scene , a synagogue in the ultra-orthodox har nof district .
israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu ordered the demolition of the suspects ' homes , and is scheduled to speak in a televised address at 17.30 local time ( 12.30 et , 15.30 gmt ) .
netanyahu said israel would respond with a heavy hand and blamed palestinian leaders .
the us confirmed that three victims were americans , and the uk said the fourth victim held dual british-israeli citizenship .
the americans were named as moshe twersky , aryeh kupinsky and kalman ze'ev levine .
the british victim was avraham shmuel goldberg .
the suspects were named as cousins ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal , both members of the popular front for the liberation of palestine .
the group praised the attack but stopped short of claiming responsibility .
relatives said the young men were angry about recent violence and friction around city holy sites .
us president barack obama condemned the horrific ' attack , saying there is and can be no justification for such attacks against innocent civilians .
secretary of state john kerry also led a chorus of international figures who denounced the violence and urge restraint .
palestinian president mahmoud abbas condemned the attack .
a statement from his office said abbas condemns the killing of civilians no matter who is doing it .

there have been reports of violence between palestinians and israelis , including reported clashes in the west bank.there are also fears of revenge attacks on palestinians by hardline israelis , and jerusalem 's mayor implored citizens not to take vigilante action .
reported clashes have broken out between israeli military forces and palestinians in ramallah , in the west bank .
journalists and palestinians in the area say that idf forces have fired teargas and are moving toward the town center .
nasser atta ( @ nasseratta5 ) # israeli army storm # ramallah center near qadoura refugee camp , and clash with # palestinian .
nasser atta ( @ nasseratta5 ) reports that the storming of ramallah by the # israeli army is to arrest pflp activist , the group said that the two attacker belong to pflp
it was a situation ripe for an explosion and that is what happened , a relative of one of the attackers has told my colleague in jerusalem , peter beaumont .

he reports from jabal mukaber , in east jerusalem : relatives of the two attackers offered different theories about the motives for the attack , with some linking it to the death of palestinian bus driver found hanged behind his bus .
other family members blamed recent friction at the jerusalem holy site known to jews as the temple mount .
you can watch the guardian 's video report from jerusalem here .

a cousin of the men , sufian abu jamal , described the attack to the guardian as a heroic act and the normal reaction of what has been happening to palestinians in jerusalem and at the al aqsa mosque .
obama has added more remarks to his statement , per abc 's jon williams .
he repeats his call for palestinians and israelis to work together and mentions that palestinian president mahmoud abbas has condemned the attack .
jon williams ( @ williamsjon ) obama : too many # israelis have died , too many palestinians died .
this kind of extremism threatens spiral from which hard to emerge .
# israel
british-israeli victim avraham shmuel goldberg was close to the beth hamerdash synagogue in golders green , london , my colleague matthew taylor reports .
on tuesday members of the congregation said the entire community had been shocked by the attack : it was early morning and these people had just left their families .
to do this in what is obviously a sacred place ¦ people here are deeply shocked and upset , mark , a 23-year-old student , speaking outside the synagogue said .

documents.title: obama condemns 'horrific ' attack
text: us president barack obama : there is and can be no justification for such attacks against innocent civilians .
obama .

martinez monsivais/ap his statement reads : i strongly condemn today 's terrorist attack on worshipers at a synagogue in jerusalem , which killed four innocent people , including us citizens aryeh kupinsky , cary william levine , and moshe twersky , and injured several more .
there is and can be no justification for such attacks against innocent civilians .
the thoughts and prayers of the american people are with the victims and families of all those who were killed and injured in this horrific attack and in other recent violence .

at sensitive moment , it is all the more important for israeli and palestinian leaders and ordinary citizens to work cooperatively together to lower tensions , reject violence and seek a path forward towards peace .
jerusalem mayor nir barkat implored israelis not to take the law into their own hands in a televised address this morning .
demonstrators have turned out in small groups around jerusalem chanting anti-arab slogans .

there have also been reports of a stabbing elsewhere in the city , but details are hazy , the jerusalem post 's ben hartman reports by way of the police : ben hartman ( @ benhartman ) jerusalem police : arab youth told bystander he was slashed in leg by group of youths at safra square in city , circumstances unclear
the militant group fatah reportedly feels emboldened by today 's attack , abc 's nasser atta tweets , quoting sources within the palestinian group .

this jerusalem war will be bloody and will go on for a long time ¦ we are in a new stage in the conflict , a source told him , while others rejected the authority of palestinian president mahmoud abbas .
nasser atta ( @ nasseratta5 ) fateh sources : `` abass will not be able to stop this intifada , the bullet is fired & both # israelis & # pales can not control future events . ''
fatah was among the militant groups responsible for firing rockets into israel during this summer 's 50-day war .
the guardian 's graphics team has sent this map indicating relevant points in jerusalem .
har nof , where the synagogue was attacked , is a neighborhood with a large ultra-orthodox population and many western immigrants .
twersky and levine , both americans , lived nearby .
the cousins ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal , identified as the assailants , lived with family in the east jerusalem district of jabal mukabe .

documents.title: netanyahu orders homes destroyed
text: israeli pm netanyahu has ordered the demolition of the abu jamal cousins ' homes , his spokesman says .
ofir gendelman ( @ ofirgendelman ) pm netanyahu has instructed to demolish the homes of the 2 palestinian terrorists who perpetrated today 's terorrist attack in jerusalem .
netanyahu has just stepped out of a security council meeting , and is due to give a statement at 7.30pm ( 12.30 et , 5.30 gmt ) .
this live stream shows the funeral of rabbi moshe twersky , one of the american-israelis killed this morning in jerusalem .
the procession has carried his coffin near the mount of olives .
twersky came from a prominent jewish family ; his father founded harvard 's center for jewish studies and his grandfather was one of the originators of the modern orthodox movement .
the us state department has confirmed the deaths of three us citizens in this morning 's synagogue attack , ap 's matt lee reports citing spokesperson jen psaki .
the american consulate general in jerusalem tweets condolences .
uscgjerusalem ( @ uscgjerusalem ) .
@ uscgjerusalem sends heartfelt condolences to the families of american citizens aryeh kupinsky , cary william levine , and mosheh twersky .

here 's a summary of the main developments : two men armed with axes , knives and a pistol have killed four rabbis and wounded several others in a jerusalem synagogue in the worst such attack in years .
two palestinians were killed in a shootout with police at the scene , a synagogue in the ultra-orthodox har nof district of west jerusalem where 25 had gathered for morning worship .
three of the victims held dual us-israeli citizenship and the fourth was a dual israeli-british citizen .
the americans were named as moshe twersky , aryeh kopinsky and calman levine .
the british victim was avraham goldberg , who had lived in golders green in north london before emigrating to israel in the 1990s .
a canadian was among the injured .
the suspects were named as cousins ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal , who were both members of the popular front for the liberation of palestine .
the group praised the attack but stopped short of claiming responsibility .
hamas , which also hailed the attack , said it was a response to the killing of a palestinian bus driver , yusuf ramuni .
israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu said israel would respond with a heavy hand , and blamed palestinian leaders for incitement .
one member of his government called for the homes of the suspects to be demolished .
palestinian president mahmoud abbas condemned the attack .
a statement from his office said abbas condemns the killing of civilians no matter who is doing it .
us secretary of state john kerry led international condemnation of the attack and urged palestinian leaders to restrain any kind of incitement .
the leaders of all the main parties in britain also condemned the attack , while foreign secretary philip hammond urged both sides to de-escalate tensions .

there have been reports of violence between palestinians and israeli settlers and the security forces in the wake of the attack.there are also fears of revenge attacks on palestinians by hardline israelis , as one group organised a protest rally .
family members of the dead suspects ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal were recently arrested for stone throwing during riots , neighbours have told buzzfeed 's sheera frenkel .
one of the suspects worked in a grocery shop near the synagogue , she told msnbc .
the attack appeared to be planned but the family said they had no knowledge of it , she said .
jerusalem is holding its breath over what will happens next , with some families planning to keep children away from school , she added .
british shadow foreign secretary douglas alexander echoes philip hammond 's call for both sides to de-escalate tensions .
he said the breakdown of negotiations was being replaced by violence .
in a statement alexander said : there is no justification for today 's horrific terrorist attack on worshippers in a synagogue in jerusalem .
this act of violence must be condemned and it is right that president abbas has done so .
claims by hamas ' leadership that these brutal murders were justified as revenge attacks are simply wrong , and risk inciting further such violence .
leaders on all sides now bear a heavy responsibility to take steps to de-escalate the situation in jerusalem and the west bank which risks spilling over into even further bloodshed .
the breakdown of peace talks between israelis and palestinians in april created a political vacuum that is now being filled with acts of terror and violence .

a return to negotiations is the only viable way forward and it is vital that both israeli and palestinian leaders now work together to overcome the latest violence that has already taken too many innocent lives .

documents.title: canadian among injured
text: a canadian was among those injured in the attack , according to cbc 's derek stoffel .
derek stoffel ( @ derekstoffelcbc ) a canadian was among those injured in the attack on a jerusalem synagogue this morning .
# cbc earlier , the canadian prime minister , stephen harper , added to international condemnation of the attack .
stephen harper ( @ pmharper ) canada condemns the barbaric act of terror against a synagogue in west jerusalem .
our thoughts & prayers are with the people of israel .
the number of those injured was initially put at six .
more recent reports say as many as 13 were injured .

vicki belovski , the wife of communal rabbi dr harvey belovski from a synagogue in golders green , north london , where avraham goldberg used to live before moving to israel , has been speaking to matthew taylor .
she said : the fact that someone can just barge into a synagogue and attack people with knives and guns is ghastly , that is a feeling that is pretty widespread round here today .
( this entry has been amended , earlier we incorrectly stated that belovski was herself a communal rabbi , apologies . )
goldberg 's family has issued a brief statement on the killing of the british rabbi in this morning 's attack .
it said : the goldberg family accepts the divine decree with love , haaretz reports .
haaretz.com ( @ haaretzcom ) family of victim of jerusalem attack : 'the goldberg family accepts divine decree with love '

documents.title: fbi launches investigation into death of us citizens
text: as three of the victims held dual us citizenship , the fbi has launched an investigation , cnn reports .

jake tapper ( @ jaketapper ) the fbi is launching an investigation into the jerusalem synagogue attack because three of victims are us citizens , @ twitterid reports the three us born israelis were identified by police as moshe twersky , aryeh kopinsky and calman levine .
twersky was from a hassidic rabbinical dynasty and a grandson of joseph soloveitchik , a renowned boston rabbi who died in 1993 , according to reuters .
the fourth victim was a british-israel named as avraham shmuel goldberg .
haaretz has a remarkable photograph from twersky 's funeral haaretz.com ( @ haaretzcom ) mourners attend funeral of rabbi moshe twersky , killed in # jerusalem terror attack today
the funeral of rabbi moshe twersky is under way in jerusalem , according to israel news .
israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) happening now : hundreds attending funeral of rav moshe twersky hy '' d killed in todays j'lem synagogue terror attack .
the funerals of the other victims were due to start at the synagogue where they were killed , it added .

israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) just in : funeral of 3 other victims killed in todays j'lem terror attack will take place in front of the synagogue they were murdered at 3pm the israeli foreign ministry said all four victims were rabbis .
israel foreign min .
( @ israelmfa ) # terror attack victims : rabbis moshe twersky,59 , aryeh kupinsky,43 , avraham shmuel goldberg,68 , and kalman levine , 55
the bbc 's quentin sommerville gives the ages of the four men killed in the attack .
quentin sommerville ( @ sommervillebbc ) killed as they prayed : moshe twersky , 59 , us citizen .
arieh kupinsky , 43 , us .
kalman levi , 55 , us avraham goldberg , 68 , uk

documents.title: foreign office confirms dual british-israeli national among victims
text: the foreign office has confirmed that one of the victims held a british passport .
a foreign office spokesman said : we are aware of the death of a dual british-israeli national in israel on 18 november 2014 .
cnn reports that the other victims held dual us-israeli citizenship .
cnn breaking news ( @ cnnbrk ) 3 of those killed in today 's jerusalem attack were dual u.s.-israeli citizens ; 4th was british-israeli , police say .
the bbc names all victims as moshe twersky , arieh kupinsky , kalman levi and avraham goldberg .
the emergency services have removed the bodies of victims from the synagogue .
emergency service workers remove bodies from a synagogue in jerusalem after it was attacked by two palestinians armed with knives and a gun .
a local resident says police arrived within minutes and killed the attackers .
speaking outside the synagogue , israel 's internal security minister yitzhak aharonovich promises to restore calm to the city

documents.title: british victim
text: one of the four victims of the attack was a british citizen , according to reports .
the foreign office said it was investigating the report .
the israel news feed named the man as abraham goldberg , who it said emigrated to israel in 1991 .
israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) heartbreaking : r ' abraham goldberg hy '' d british citizen emigrated to israel in 1991 killed in todays terror attack .
jewish news identified the british victim as rabbi avraham shmuel goldberg .
it said he was originally from liverpool and had lived in golders green .
he was the most wonderful person you could meet , a pillar of the community , one of avraham 's best friends , david osborne , who narrowly missed being caught in the attack , told jewish news .
i was on my way to the synagogue when i heard screams and shots being fired , i knew instantly it was bad .
israel is to ease gun controls for those licensed to carry weapons such as off-duty army officers or private security guards , public security minister , yitzhak aharonovich , has announced .
he told idf radio that in the wake of the synagogue killings the easing of restrictions would apply to incidents of self-defence , israel national news reports .
earlier , aharonovich had called for calm and warned against vigilante attacks .
he called on the public not to take the law into their own hands and allow security forces to do their job .

here 's a summary of the main developments : two men armed with axes , knives and a pistol have killed four israelis and wounded several others in a jerusalem synagogue in the worst such attack in years .
two palestinians were killed in shootout with police at the scene , a synagogue in the ultra-orthodox har nof district of west jerusalem where 25 had gathered for morning worship .
the suspects were named as cousins ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal , who were both members of the popular front for the liberation of palestine .
the group praised the attack but stopped short of claiming responsibility .
hamas , which also hailed the attack , said it was a response to the killing of a palestinian bus driver , yusuf ramuni .
israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu said israel would respond with a heavy hand , and blamed palestinian leaders for incitement .
one member of his government called for the homes of the suspects to be demolished .
palestinian president mahmoud abbas condemned the attack .
a statement from his office said abbas condemns the killing of civilians no matter who is doing it .
us secretary of state john kerry led international condemnation of the attack and urged palestinian leaders to restrain any kind of incitement .
the leaders of all the main parties in britain also condemned the attack , while foreign secretary philip hammond urged both sides to de-escalate tensions .
one of the victims was identified as a rabbi who taught at a jerusalem seminary .
witnesses , including paramedics , described horrific scenes at the synagogue .
there have been reports of violence between palestinians and israeli settlers and the security forces in the wake of the attack .
there are also fears of revenge attacks on palestinians by hardline israelis , as one group organised a protest rally .

journalist dalia hatuqa tweets a translation of that statement by the armed wing of the popular front for the liberation of palestine , which praises the attack but stops just short of a claim of responsibility .
dalia hatuqa ( @ daliahatuqa ) here 's the pflp statement in english .
praise for 2 members who carried out attack but no claim of responsibility .
uk foreign secretary philip hammond pool/getty images britain 's foreign secretary philip hammond called on both israelis and palestinians to de-escalate tensions .

in a statement he said : alongside secretary kerry , i condemned in the strongest possible terms the appalling attack that took place this morning at a synagogue in jerusalem , in which at least four people have been murdered in a place of worship .
i call on all world leaders to step up and condemn this brutality .
both sides must do everything possible to de-escalate tensions , which are extremely dangerous for the israeli and palestinian communities .
here 's video of john kerry 's angry condemnation of the attack .
plus a guardian version of that mobile phone footage of the shootout outside the synagogue .
there have been reports of violence flaring up between palestinians and israeli settlers in the west bank and between israeli security forces and palestinians in ramallah .

israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) happening now : clashes ongoing between palestinians and israeli forces near ramalla following terror attack - eng nasser atta ( @ nasseratta5 ) clashes between 200 palestinians and 50 israeli settlers near yitzhar settlement in west bank .
palestinian media

documents.title: suspects ' homes raided
text: the dead suspects have been identified as cousins ghassan abu jamal and uday abu jamal , according to the ma'an news agency .
it said their homes in east jerusalem were raided by israeli forces , citing witnesses in the jabal mukaber area .
they said the officers raided the homes , beat residents and detained two members of the abu jamal families.meanwhile , israeli police closed the entrance to the jabal mukaber neighbourhood .
israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) photos : israeli forces surround home of terrorists involved in todays massive terror attack in jerusalem , 9 arrested .
israeli police spokeswoman luba samri confirmed the names of the suspects as ghassan and uday abu jamal , ap reports .
israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) photo : cousin terrorists uday & ghassan abu jamal from the village of jabbal mukabber involved in todays attack .
a member of the israeli government has called for the demolition of the suspects ' homes as soon as today .
according to ynet , the call was made by yair lapid , minister of finance and chairman of the yesh atid party .
more international condemnation , this time from germany 's foreign minister .

germanforeignoffice ( @ germanydiplo ) # steinmeier condemns fatal attack on # jerusalem synagogue : attacks on innocent believers in places of worship are terrible transgression 1/2 germanforeignoffice ( @ germanydiplo ) fm # steinmeier cont 'd : hope that attack is a wake-up call .
overlap of pol .
issues w/ rel .
confrontation gives new dimension to conflict .
in jerusalem there are fears of revenge attacks on palestinians from hardline israelis , after at least one group organised a protest rally .
gregg carlstrom ( @ glcarlstrom ) small crowd gathered at the scene of the synagogue attack chanting `` death to terrorists '' and `` revenge . ''
elizabeth tsurkov ( @ elizrael ) jewish supremacists ( kach + lehava ) are organizing a protest/riot in jerusalem at 19:00 tonight
political leaders in the uk have added to international condemnation of the attack .
david cameron ( @ david cameron ) i 'm appalled by today 's horrific attack on worshippers at a jerusalem synagogue .
my thoughts are with the victims ' families .
nick clegg ( @ nick clegg ) very sad to wake up to news of what is believed to be a terrorist attack in a synagogue in jerusalem .

thoughts with people of that holy city update : labour leader added : ed miliband ( @ ed miliband ) i 'm horrified by the barbaric attack on the synagogue in jerusalem - an appalling act of terrorism to be totally condemned .

former tory co-chairman baroness warsi , who resigned earlier this year as a foreign office minister over the government 's support for israel 's assault on gaza , urged politicians to condemn violence on both sides .
sayeeda warsi ( @ sayeedawarsi ) both @ twitterid cameron & @ twitterid miliband say a palestinian life is equal to an israeli life so let 's all condemn the killing on both sides

documents.title: pflp says suspects were members
text: the popular front for the liberation of palestine appears to have claimed responsibility for the attack .
abc 's nasser atta quoted the group as saying that the two suspects were members .

nasser atta ( @ nasseratta5 ) pflp- popular front for the liberation of palestine ( leftist group ) say the two # palestinian attackers in # jerusalem belong to the group the group 's armed wing claimed responsibility for the attack , according to journalist khaled abu toameh .
khaled abu toameh ( @ khaledabutoameh ) pflp 's armed wing , abu ali mustafa brigades , claims responsibility for jerusalem synagogue terror attack .
but later he reported a pflp spokesman saying it was too early to talk of responsibility for the attack .
khaled abu toameh ( @ khaledabutoameh ) pflp spox : `` premature '' to talk about our responsibility for `` heroic '' synagogue attack .

documents.title: rabbi killed in the attack
text: the israeli media has identified one of the victims as a rabbi .
the israeli news feed said the funeral of rabbi moshe twersky would take place at 2pm on tuesday .
israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) heartbreaking : rosh yeshiva kollel toras moshe rabbi moshe twersky hy '' d killed in todays jerusalem terror attack .
france 's president , franã§ois hollande , has condemned in the strongest terms what he described as a heinous attack .
he also expressed concern about the recent spate of violence in jerusalem and the west bank .
afp has more graphic accounts of the attacks from witnesses .

there were people running from the synagogue , and a man sitting on the pavement covered in blood , it looked like he has been stabbed , said local resident sarah abrahams , who was walking past when it happened .

two people came out with their faces half missing , looking like they 'd been attacked with knives , she said as hundreds of ultra-orthodox jews pressed up against the police tape , a few chanting death to terrorists .
fighting back tears , moshe eliezer said he had narrowly avoided being at the scene after oversleeping .
this is a yeshiva community .
ninety percent do n't serve in the army .
we 're not violent , he said .
details are emerging about the suspects .
police said the attackers were two cousins from the east jerusalem neighbourhood of jabal mukaber .
speaking to journalists at the scene , jerusalem mayor nir barkat expressed shock at the scale of the bloodshed .
to slaughter innocent people while they pray it 's insane , he said .
afp also confirms that hamas praised assault as a response to the death earlier this week of a palestinian bus driver from east jerusalem who was found hanged inside his vehicle .
the operation in jerusalem is a response to the murder of the martyr yusuf ramuni and to the series of crimes by the occupier at al-aqsa , hamas spokesman sami abu zuhri said in a statement .
hamas calls for more operations like it .
secretary of state john kerry speaks to the media about the attack that took place this morning as british foreign secretary philip hammond listens .
dunham/ap

documents.title: clashes in east jerusalem
text: there have been several reports of clashes in east jerusalem close to where the two suspects were reported to have lived .
sheera frenkel ( @ sheeraf ) clashes now in the jabal mukubar neighborhood in east jerusalem , where the 2 men who attacked the synagogue this morning lived .
israel news feed ( @ israelhatzolah ) right now : clashes between palestinians and israeli forces at jabal mukabber neighborhood where terrorists lived , qualndiya area as well .
abbas sarsour ( @ ifalasteen ) occupation forces close off jabal almukabr now and it 's on total lockdown in alquds right now # intifadaalaqsa

documents.title: abbas condemns the attack
text: palestinian president mahmoud abbas kulbis/ap palestinian president mahmoud abbas has done what kerry asked by condemning the attack .
in a statement his office said : the presidency condemns the attack on jewish worshippers in their place of prayer and condemns the killing of civilians no matter who is doing it .

documents.title: kerry issues angry condemnation
text: the us has issued a forthright condemnation of the attack , ap reports .
us secretary of state john kerry said : innocent people who had come to worship died in the sanctuary of a synagogue .
they were hatcheted , hacked and murdered in that holy place in an act of pure terror and senseless brutality and murder .
i call on palestinians at every single level of leadership to condemn this in the most powerful terms .
this violence has no place anywhere , particularly after the discussion that we just had the other day in amman .
to have this kind of act , which is a pure result of incitement , of calls for days of rage , ' of just irresponsibility , is unacceptable .

the palestinian leadership must condemn this and they must begin to take serious steps to restrain any kind of incitement and exhibit the kind of leadership that is necessary to put this region on a different path .
this simply has no place in human behaviour and we need to hear from leaders who are going to lead their people to a different place .
jen psaki ( @ statedeptspox ) .
@ johnkerry meets with fs hammond in london .
condemns attack in jerusalem .
will discuss iran , ukraine , isil , ebola
video has emerged of a shootout at the entrance of the synagogue , as peter mentioned earlier .
one of the paramedics who attended the dead and wounded appeared to have arrived while the siege was still going on , peter beaumont reports .
the paramedic described one of the victims drenched in blood after his chest had been repeatedly stabbed .
the injured victim thought he had been shot but his wounds were consistent with a knife or axe attack , the paramedic told peter .
as he went further into the synagogue , he heard sounds of shooting and saw another man lying in a pool of blood .
at some stage , and the description is quite confused , one of the paramedics appears to have been injured in some way .
as he was working he saw one of the policemen shot in the head ' during the exchange of gunfire , and went to give him first aid .
peter added : it 's very confused but it sounds chaotic that there were people , paramedics and police perhaps inside the synagogue it sounds very confused , very horrific .

documents.title: netanyahu vows to 'respond with a heavy hand '
text: israeli pm binyamin netanyahu kahana/ pool/epa the israeli prime minister binyamin netanyahu called the attack a brutal murder of jews who came to pray and blamed both the palestinian militant group hamas and palestinian president , mahmoud abbas , for incitement he said had led to the attack .

this is the direct result of the incitement being led by hamas and abu mazen [ abbas ] , incitement which the international community is irresponsibly ignoring , he said , according to a statement posted on his facebook page netanyahu who is to meet his security chiefs on tuesday afternoon said israel would respond with a heavy hand to the attack .

documents.title: witnesses describe gunshots
text: eyewitnesses have described hearing gunshots and seeing police gathered at the entrance to the synagogue , peter beaumont reports in another audio update from the scene .
one of the witnesses heard someone shout they 're coming out in apparent reference to the suspects .
he then said he saw a man shot at the entrance .
the witness was unclear about whether the suspect was armed .
another eyewitness said she heard first some gunshots , then when the police arrived a lot more gunshots , peter said .
uri maklev , a united torah judaism mp , who was involved in building the synagogue , has called for restrictions to be placed on palestinians from east jerusalem .
he said the suspects must have planned the attack and scoped out the synagogue in advance .
he said they came here to kill jews , peter reported .
kill them like animals , ' he said .
maklev said the israeli government would need to rethink its policy of work permits and security clearance for people who work in the west of the city .
that would be very large and controversial step , peter commented .
the suspects were armed with a pistol as well as knives and axes , police have told the guardian 's israel correspondent peter beaumont who is at the scene .
the gun battle outside the synagogue was caught on video , peter said .
you can see police firing into the entrance of the synagogue where the two attackers were shot and killed .
one of the policemen was seriously wounded in the exchange of fire .
peter says an attack on a synagogue is unusual in the history of the conflict between israelis and palestinians , but that it comes after a period of heightened religious violence in jerusalem .
there is already a tremendous amount of security in the city - they have put concrete bollards on the light rail stops to stop hit-and-run attacks .
there are observation balloons over parts of the old city .
we have seen plainclothes squads going into crowds throwing stones .
there has already been a huge increase in the police presence , you can imagine that will be even more now .

documents.title: israeli police describe 'killing nightmare '
text: police spokesman micky rosenfeld said the two suspects attacked innocent worshippers with knives and axes before being shot dead .
speaking to bbc radio 4 's today programme , he said no warning had been given before the attack .
rosenfeld confirmed that four people were pronounced dead at the scene and a futher six were injured , including four seriously .
he said both attackers were killed at the entrance to the synagogue and that no further terrorists are in the area .
he said the terrorists went into a place of peace and turned it into a killing nightmare .
this is the guardian 's live coverage of the aftermath of a deadly attack on a synagogue in jerusalem .

heightened security has been imposed on the city after two suspected terrorists armed with guns , axes and knives killed at least four people at the synagogue in ultra-orthodox har nof neighbourhood in the deadliest attack in jerusalem in years .
there are four dead and six injured , among them two policemen , police spokeswoman luba samri said in a statement .
both attackers , identified as palestinians from east jerusalem , were shot dead by police .
hamas appeared to praise the attack .
in a statement , the islamist hamas movement said it was a response to the murder of the martyr yusuf ramun .
it was referring to the bus driver from east jerusalem who was found hanged inside his vehicle late on sunday in an incident israeli police described as suicide .

1.57pm GMT
13:57
FBI launches investigation into death of US citizens

9.39am GMT
09:39
Rabbi killed in the attack

bulletin.text: Four worshippers killed in terrorist attack on Jerusalem synagogue.
Two suspects from PFLP shot dead by Israeli police.
Hamas hailed the attack while Abbas condemned it.
